intro: Tetraria exilis, commonly known as the slender tetraria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Tetraria exilis is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
